summary: In Super Mario Sunshine, it is possible to enter the portal to Ricco Harbor from below the boat house simply by swimming...
caption:
In Super Mario Sunshine, it is possible to enter the portal to Ricco Harbor from below the boat house simply by swimming underneath the portal and pressing A. Mario will automatically float upwards out of the water and activate the portal.
Main Blog | Twitter | Patreon | Store | Source: myself, Super Mario Sunshine (NA, GC) in GC emulator

tags: Super Dragon Ball Heroes: World Mission
summary: [Video] Super Dragon Ball Heroes World Mission – A New Way To Take Dragon Ball Characters To Battle
title: [Video] Super Dragon Ball Heroes World Mission – A New Way To Take Dragon Ball Characters To Battle
body:
[Video] Super Dragon Ball Heroes World Mission – A New Way To Take Dragon Ball Characters To Battle

Bandai Namco have shared a new trailer for the Card Battle game featuring everyone’s favourite Saiyan Goku and friends. Super Dragon Ball Heroes World Mission is a new take on the Super Dragon Ball series. Players will have to build their elite deck of cards and fight against others with over 350 heroes to pick and choose and 1000 different cards to combine and use.

We have the new trailer below…

View On WordPress

summary: Gearbox May Be Teasing A Nintendo Switch Version Of Borderlands 2
title: Gearbox May Be Teasing A Nintendo Switch Version Of Borderlands 2
body:
Gearbox May Be Teasing A Nintendo Switch Version Of Borderlands 2

Gearbox has been teasing quite a few things lately, but the latest one may interest you. The company has posted another teaser tweet on their Twitter page, suggesting that Borderlands 2 news is being announced at PAX East, which takes place in a couple of weeks. A lot of people are speculating that the announcement is for a Nintendo Switchversion of the game. Whenever we find out what it is,…

View On WordPress

summary: Hmm, im watching a video about how piracy is moral due to exclusives and to a point i get what he’s saying and  things like...
body:
Hmm, im watching a video about how piracy is moral due to exclusives and to a point i get what he’s saying and  things like first party exclusives on consoles and i agree that say nintendo would be viable in selling their games on other platforms, however a few things go against that.

1) Exclusives drive sales which drive the company’s want to innovate.

2) Nintendo’s games would most likely not sell well in a crowded PC environment.

3) Nintendo is overly protective of their brands as allowing games on other consoles has not worked out greatly for them in the past and they have their own ideals on what “Nintendo” means.

4) Without them the games would not exist so its only fair that they would have it on their own system.

5) BECAUSE exclusives are meant to drive up sales of hardware they are usually less inclined to push for business practices that other game makers do, such as lootboxes, always online experiences, broken and unfinished games on release, microtransactions, 8 different special editions and so on and so forth. There’s of course exceptions but generally thats the case.

However given the nature of the development of the future I do think the approach of things like Xbox where they have a console but seem to want to put their games on phones and tablets via streaming and even seem to want to put their games on the Switch (that’s a rumor thats been going around) might be a more ideal paradigm.

However, I don’t think Nintendo or Sony specifically would do that and I’m personally fine with that but of course, the “first party exclusives are monopolies” thing i used to regard as nonesense but I now see it as a valid point, but one that I don’t fully agree with.

2) Nintendo’s games would most likely not sell well in a crowded PC environment.

5) BECAUSE exclusives are meant to drive up sales of hardware they are usually less inclined to push for business practices that other game makers do, such as lootboxes, always online experiences, broken and unfinished games on release, microtransactions, 8 different special editions and so on and so forth. There’s of course exceptions but generally thats the case.

blog.name: pokemon-professor-sakura
blog.title: Asks: CLOSED! Submissions: OPEN!
blog.description:
(This is a roleplay blog run by @chickadee567)

((Talking out of character))

Hello there! I’m Professor Sakura, and I’m always willing

to help trainers and caretakers with their Pokemon.

You can ask me about Pokemon behavior, where certain Pokemon can be found,

and even report sightings of rare or mythical Pokemon.

((Search for the tag #rules to find rules for asks and submissions!))

summary: Who's your favorite professor you know?
question: Who's your favorite professor you know?
answer:
If I had to choose, probably Professor Sycamore. He’s really nice.

- Professor Sakura
